intro: Saracha weberbaueri subsp. pallascana, commonly known as the Yunnan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations. It has hairy leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
